intro: Cancrinia submarginata, commonly known as the narrow-margin crinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces a tall, leafless stem that bears clusters of flowers, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
